intro: Hedyotis flynnii, commonly known as the New Zealand geranium, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, clustered white or pink flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hedyotis flynnii is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture.
